Here’s the economic formula for humanoid robots:

C < (b₁ · n₁) + (b₂ · n₂) + ...

Where:
C = Cost of the robot
b·n = Benefit times Cycles for *each task*

A single-purpose robot has one b·n to justify its cost. A humanoid sums the value of all the different tasks it can https://t.co/pgHMYWUZcJ

fullText:

Trump has the opportunity to fine-tune tariffs in a way that lowers grocery bills, keeps more profits in the hands of American farmers and secures US jobs!
